nodes.html: <figcaption class="Figure-caption"> Democrat Andrea Campbell launched her campaign for Massachusetts Attorney General in Boston on February 2, 2022</figcaption>

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: The Democrat is a former Boston City Councilor who ran unsuccessfully for mayor last year

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: Andrea Campbell, who made history as the first Black woman to serve as president of the Boston City Council, is running for Massachusetts Attorney General.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: She is one of three people seeking the Democratic nomination.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: The incumbent, Democrat Maura Healey is running for governor.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: The other Democrats seeking the nomination are labor attorney Shannon Liss-Riordan and Quentin Palfrey, who was the Democratic nominee for lieutenant governor in 2018. Republican Jay McMahon is also running.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: WAMC’s Pioneer Valley Bureau Chief Paul Tuthill spoke with Campbell.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: Specifically, what are some of the key issues in your platform?

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: As a candidate for mayor of Boston last year, you advocated for criminal justice reforms, including eliminating cash bail, eliminating mandatory minimum sentences. Are those issues that you would again lobby for if you become Attorney General?

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: So just to be clear, you'd like to eliminate cash bail, is that is that something that you favor?

Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: Since you've mentioned this a couple of times now, can you can you expand on that since I assume most people don't know the story of what happened with your brother, can you can you can you tell us please?

nodes.html: Would pursuing and prosecuting political corruption cases be a be a priority for you? Or would you leave it to the US attorney as the current attorney general has often done?

nodes.html: The Attorney General's Office has about 500 employees. Do you have the experience to oversee and manage such a large state workforce?

nodes.html: Andrea Campbell, who made history as the first Black woman to serve as president of the Boston City Council, is running for Massachusetts Attorney General.

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: She is one of three people seeking the Democratic nomination.

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: The incumbent, Democrat Maura Healey is running for governor.

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: The other Democrats seeking the nomination are labor attorney Shannon Liss-Riordan and Quentin Palfrey, who was the Democratic nominee for lieutenant governor in 2018. Republican Jay McMahon is also running.

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: WAMC’s Pioneer Valley Bureau Chief Paul Tuthill spoke with Campbell.

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: Specifically, what are some of the key issues in your platform?

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: As a candidate for mayor of Boston last year, you advocated for criminal justice reforms, including eliminating cash bail, eliminating mandatory minimum sentences. Are those issues that you would again lobby for if you become Attorney General?

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: So just to be clear, you'd like to eliminate cash bail, is that is that something that you favor?

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: Since you've mentioned this a couple of times now, can you can you expand on that since I assume most people don't know the story of what happened with your brother, can you can you can you tell us please?

nodes.html: Would pursuing and prosecuting political corruption cases be a be a priority for you? Or would you leave it to the US attorney as the current attorney general has often done?

nodes.html: The Attorney General's Office has about 500 employees. Do you have the experience to oversee and manage such a large state workforce?

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: I assume you're familiar with the with the health and safety concerns that have been raised about the Roderick Ireland courthouse here in Springfield. As Attorney General, would you be comfortable having members of your staff inside that building?

none.message: Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text
Element does not duplicate existing text in alt text

nodes.html: This is something I still have to get more familiar with. I've heard different concerns about it from folks who are currently in the AG’s office as well as folks, of course in the community, and of course, would work with the staff at the AG’s office to address it.
